text:
First Avenue (across view from right to left and obscured by roof tops) north from E. 23rd Street (extreme right) showing a general view northeastward from a loft structure at the S.E. corner of Second Avenue and E. 22nd Street. Silhouetted against the Bellevue Hospital Buildings is the New York Life Insurance Co. printing plant building at the S.W.. corner of First Avenue and E. 25th Street. The J.J. Little and Ives Co. printing plant and book bindery is on the north side of E. 24th Street east of
First Avenue and near the East River.
September 3, 1929.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr
No Reproductions
Neg. #4501

First Avenue (across view from right to left and obscured by roof tops) north from E. 23rd Street (extreme right) showing a general view northeastward from a loft structure at the S.E. corner of Second Avenue and E. 22nd Street. Little and Ives Co. printing plant and book bindery is on the north side of E. 24th Street east of
First Avenue and near the East River.
September 3, 1929.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr
No Reproductions
Neg. #4501

(1) Guests en route to excursion steamer, on the occasion of the Police Dept's annual outing for mothers and children. This view taken at East 22nd Street, between First Ave., and Ave. A.
Summer 1936, ?
May be reproduced.

(2) The Police Department band and several officials, at the head of the contingent.
Summer 1936?
May be reproduced.
Neg. #1781
title: Police Department - Outing.
